subject: Sexual Health
title: Early Condom History
description: Learn Early Condom History in one minute.

hook.text: The oldest known condom dates to 1640, made from animal intestine and tied with a silk ribbon.

buildup.text: Linen sheaths soaked in chemicals appeared in the 1500s, used more for disease prevention than birth control.

discovery.text: Vulcanized rubber condoms arrived in the 1850s after Charles Goodyear's rubber process was invented.

twist.text: Early rubber condoms were thick, reusable, and uncomfortable. Latex versions came only in the 1920s.

climax.text: The condom evolved from animal gut to high-tech latex over centuries, driven by persistent demand.

punchline.text: From sheep intestine to latex. Centuries of progress.

quiz.question: When were vulcanized rubber condoms introduced?
